meanings.definition: An irrational fear or aversion to computers.
meanings.sent1: Her computerphobia made it challenging for her to even look at a laptop.
meanings.sent2: His computerphobia prevented him from applying for online jobs.
meanings.sent3: Despite his computerphobia, he tried to conquer his fear by attending a basic computer class.
meanings.sent4: The computerphobia looming over her like a dark cloud hindered her progress in the digital age.
meanings.sent5: The computerphobia gnawed at his confidence, making every click on the mouse a daunting task.

meanings.definition: The anxiety or discomfort experienced when using or interacting with computers.
meanings.sent1: She felt a wave of computerphobia wash over her as she stared at the complex software.
meanings.sent2: His computerphobia often led to sweaty palms whenever he had to troubleshoot tech issues.
meanings.sent3: The computerphobia crept up on him whenever he had to type on the unfamiliar keyboard.
meanings.sent4: The computerphobia gripped her mind like a vice, making each digital task seem insurmountable.
meanings.sent5: The computerphobia whispered doubts in his ear, causing hesitation with every click of the mouse.
